intro: Chaetanthera pusilla, commonly known as the small hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by both animals and humans.
